meanings.definition: The collective group of people who read a particular publication or material.
meanings.sent1: The readerships of the magazine were eager to see the latest issue.
meanings.sent2: She studied the readerships of different newspapers for her research project.
meanings.sent3: The readerships at the library were so engrossed in their books that they didn't notice the time passing.
meanings.sent4: The readerships of the online blog soared after the viral post.
meanings.sent5: The diverse readerships of the book club made for lively discussions.

meanings.definition: The act of reading or the state of being a reader.
meanings.sent1: Her readerships increased when she started a daily reading habit.
meanings.sent2: The readerships of the novel were captivated by the author's storytelling.
meanings.sent3: His readerships at the library were so frequent that the librarian knew him by name.
meanings.sent4: The readerships of poetry often find solace in the written word.
meanings.sent5: The readerships of the magazine enjoyed the articles on various topics.
